setResult(R).Description: Sets the result of the API call. Assuming that a failure or cancelation has not already been set, the result will be returned to the client via @B_com#google#android#gms#common#api#Batch#await_E@ or @B_com#google#android#gms#common#api#ResultCallback#onResult_E@. This method must called at most once.

await(long, java.util.concurrent.TimeUni.Description: Blocks until the task is completed or has timed out waiting for the result. This is not allowed on the UI thread. The returned result object can have an additional failure mode of either @B_com#google#android#gms#common#api#CommonStatusCodes#INTERRUPTED_E@ or @B_com#google#android#gms#common#api#CommonStatusCodes#TIMEOUT_E@.
await(long, java.util.concurrent.TimeUni.FullName: public final BatchResult await (long time, TimeUnit units)

setResultCallback(com.google.android.gms.Description: Set the callback here if you want the result to be delivered via a callback when the result is ready or has timed out waiting for the result. The returned result object can have an additional failure mode of @B_com#google#android#gms#common#api#CommonStatusCodes#TIMEOUT_E@.
setResultCallback(com.google.android.gms.FullName: public final void setResultCallback (ResultCallback<R extends Result> callback, long time, TimeUnit units)

isCanceled().Description: Indicates whether the pending result has been canceled either due to calling @B_com#google#android#gms#common#api#GoogleApiClient#disconnect_E@ or calling @B_com#google#android#gms#common#api#PendingResult#cancel_E@ directly on the pending result or an enclosing @B_com#google#android#gms#common#api#Batch_E@.

cancel().Description: Requests that the batch be canceled. Cancels all underlying PendingResults. @B_com#google#android#gms#common#api#ResultCallback#onResult_E@ will never be called, @B_com#google#android#gms#common#api#Batch#await_E@ will return a failed result with status @B_com#google#android#gms#common#api#CommonStatusCodes#CANCELED_E@.

forceFailureUnlessReady(com.google.andro.Description: Forces the result of the API call a failure, unless a result has otherwise already been set.

onResultConsumed().Description: Called when the result is returned by @B_com#google#android#gms#common#api#Batch#await_E@ or delivered via a @B_com#google#android#gms#common#api#ResultCallback_E@.

setResultCallback(com.google.android.gms.Description: Set the callback here if you want the result to be delivered via a callback when the result is ready.
setResultCallback(com.google.android.gms.FullName: public final void setResultCallback (ResultCallback<R extends Result> callback)

await().Description: Blocks until the task is completed. This is not allowed on the UI thread. The returned result object can have an additional failure mode of @B_com#google#android#gms#common#api#CommonStatusCodes#INTERRUPTED_E@.

createFailedResult(com.google.android.gm.Description: Creates a result of type that represents a failure with the specified @B_com#google#android#gms#common#api#Status_E@.

ClassDesc: Handles a batch of @B_com#google#android#gms#common#api#PendingResult_E@ items. Callbacks can be added and you can block to wait for all items in the batch to complete like any other @B_com#google#android#gms#common#api#PendingResult_E@ item. A Batch can also be canceled if the results are no longer needed. In this case, the onBatchComplete callback will never be triggered. The results can be taken either from the underlying @B_com#google#android#gms#common#api#PendingResult_E@s or via @B_com#google#android#gms#common#api#BatchResult#take_E@ but not both.
